title: [K-12] Game-Based Science Learning Program for Strengthening Preservice Teachers' Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of fundamental science concepts and foundational pedagogical knowledge
context.additional_context: Implementation of a dual learning structure where learners and teachers simultaneously perform dual roles in a digital device-provided environment

learning_goals: Learners can design and evaluate game-based learning activities to measure cognitive learning outcomes in science subjects.
Learners can analyze changes in the affective domain (interest, motivation) by utilizing game elements (levels, rewards, feedback).
Learners can comprehensively evaluate the effectiveness of game-based instruction by applying the Kirkpatrick evaluation model and the CRESST learning model.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
